text.1:
The Quran is a holy book revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, and it contains nothing that could cause people to doubt its truth.

The truth of the Quran encompasses all aspects contained within it, such as laws, sharia that is *shalih fi kulli zaman wa makan* (suitable for all times and places), various parables, stories, and its guidance which must be followed by humans to achieve happiness in this world and the hereafter.

The truth of the Quran was proven in the early days of Islam. By adhering firmly to the Quran, Muslims were able to build a nation with high culture and noble character. The Quran motivates people to rise up and fight to uphold truth, destroy evil, establish justice, and eliminate oppression. By implementing the guidance of the Quran, Muslims were able to become a dignified nation. But when the Quran was abandoned, Muslims chose the worldly life over the eternal hereafter, and as a result of the Muslims' lack of faith in the promises of Allah contained in the Quran, Muslims turned into a backward nation, entangled in poverty and ignorance. If Muslims today do not realize their mistakes and do not try to correct them, by returning to implementing the messages of the Quran, then Muslims will remain mired in their ignorance. Allah will not change their fate if they do not change their own fate. Allah swt. says:

"Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves." (ar-Rad/13: 11)
text.2:
This verse explains the proofs of the truth of the Quran by presenting signs or evidence of the existence of Allah who revealed the Quran. The existence of Allah is proven by the various creations that humans can see and feel in this universe.

In detail, Allah explains the state of the heavens that are raised without pillars, the movement of the sun and moon, each orbiting according to a predetermined time and place, the state of the earth full of mountains and valleys with rivers flowing between them, and the existence of various kinds of gardens that produce a variety of fruits. All of this shows that only Allah can give benefit and harm, who can give life and death, and who is All-Powerful over all things.

The signs of Allah's power in the heavens are explained in this verse:

1.  Creating the heavens above the earth without pillars as usually seen by all creatures, and the very far distance between the objects in the heavens, all of which orbit according to Allah's own provisions and regulations, like objects that appear to float in space.

2.  Then Allah is established on His Throne (Arasy) and regulates this universe. His wisdom has been explained at length in Surah al-Araf and Surah Yunus.

3.  Allah SWT has subjected the sun and moon for the benefit of all His creatures, each moving on its rotation/trajectory according to a predetermined time. The movement of the sun and moon has been explained in detail in Surah Yunus and Surah Hud. Allah SWT perfectly regulates all events in His kingdom. He gives life and death, creates and annihilates, gives wealth and poverty, and sends down revelation to whomever He wills. All of this shows that Allah has absolute power and vast mercy, because determining the creation of a creature with certain conditions, characteristics, and nature can only be carried out by the Most Great and All-Powerful God. He regulates the material and spiritual realms, and He regulates objects that are very large and very small, all with full wisdom and prudence.

From a scientific point of view, the sky or *sama* in this verse can mean the blue sky or the atmosphere close to this earth. In a broader sense, *sama* can also be interpreted as outer space, which is very vast.

The atmosphere is a layer of gas that covers a planet (including the earth). It forms the airspace. The atmosphere is divided into 6 (six) regions according to their altitude, one above the other. In order from the lowest region, the atmosphere is divided into: (1) Troposphere (altitude: 0-8 Km), (2) Tropopause, altitude: 8-12 Km (3) Stratosphere (altitude: 12-80 Km), (4) Mesosphere (altitude: 80 Km) (5) Ionosphere (altitude: 100 Km) and (6) Exosphere (altitude >100Km). The formation of clouds, weather, and so on is in the Troposphere region. The composition of the atmosphere (in the Troposphere region) is mostly nitrogen gas (78%), and also oxygen (20%). This atmosphere covers the earth and can stand upright on the earth because of the earth's gravity. This is the meaning of raising the sky without pillars. Of course, this is an interpretation of the sky that is different from the seven layers of heaven that concern galaxies and so on.

Regarding the sky without pillars, from the point of view of construction structure, a structure without pillars is only possible if the construction is in the shape of a sphere or similar to a sphere (spherical, surface of revolution), although experts have not agreed on its shape; some state it is a sphere, like a saddle, or even like a trumpet. In this construction, the walls and pillars merge into the surface of the sphere itself. So, the construction of the sky without pillars is only possible if the sky is spherical, in accordance with scientific findings which state that the universe is a large sphere that is expanding increasingly larger at the speed of light, namely at a speed of 300 thousand kilometers per second (the expanding universe).

Outer space has indeed been formed since the Big Bang and continues to expand and widen. In Surah az-zariat/51:47 it is mentioned: "And the heaven We constructed with might, and indeed, We are expanders." The word *sama* in verse 47 of Surah az-zariat/51 above is more appropriately interpreted as outer space. Outer space is indeed constantly expanding (space expansion). Research on the spectrum of galaxies shows a regular redshift spectrum, which explains that the distance between galaxies is increasing, and this is an indication that outer space is expanding. Of course, this sky does not require pillars; because it was built with the tremendous power of Allah SWT in the form of the Big Bang. The Big Bang has broken the Superforce into Fundamental Forces such as: Gravitational Force, Strong Nuclear Force, Weak Nuclear Force, and Electromagnetic Force; all of which stabilize this outer space.

Furthermore, in verse-2 it is mentioned: "He subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term." The word "subjected" means that both the sun and the moon are subject to *sunatullah*, or the laws of nature from Allah. Regarding "each running [its course] for a specified term", see the explanation in Surah Yunus/10: 5 above. This is the explanation from a scientist's point of view.

All of this happens thanks to Allah's perfection in His Essence, attributes, knowledge, and power, which cannot be imitated by anyone. Allah regulates the affairs of His creatures, explains the signs of His greatness with very neat and perfect regulations, and regulates the objects in the heavens so that they move according to predetermined paths, like links in a chain that are connected so that there are no collisions in space that can cause disaster and calamity. All of this continues until the Day of Judgment, where there will be chaos and disorder in the workings of the objects in the heavens. The destruction of the universe begins with the splitting of the sky, as explained in Allah's word:

When the sky has split [open], and when the stars have scattered. (al-Infithar/82:1-2)

Then Allah explains that the signs of the perfection of His power in the heavens and on the earth are a means that can create conviction for mankind about the meeting with Allah the Creator on the Day of Judgment, where He will give rewards to those who do good and punish those who do evil. If humans believe in this truth, surely they can turn away from the worship of idols and statues to sincerity in worshiping only Allah the One and Only, believe in His promises and threats, believe in all His messengers, follow all His commands and avoid His prohibitions, so that they become happy people in this world and in the hereafter.
text.3:
In this verse, Allah explains other aspects of His signs of power that exist on Earth, namely:

1. He is Allah who spread out the earth to be vast and wide so that it could easily be made a dwelling place for His creatures. All animals can live on it freely. Humans can benefit from the earth's produce, its animals, and the metallic objects buried within it, and can roam the earth to seek sustenance and all its benefits. Because it is so vast, the earth appears to be a flat plain, even though its actual shape is spherical, as believed by scholars of astronomy.

2. Allah has placed mountains on the surface of this earth as pillars and pegs that maintain the stability of the earth so that it does not move or shift.

3. Allah has created rivers on the earth for the benefit of humans and animals. Humans can irrigate their gardens and fields with the water of these rivers, which will later produce various agricultural products and fruits.

4. The flowers of fruit trees are made by Allah in pairs, where there are male and female elements. Science has established that a tree will not bear fruit unless there has been pollination between the male element (pollen) and the female element (pistil), which is usually found in most types of trees. There are trees that only have male elements, while the female elements are on other trees, so they need to be pollinated in order to bear fruit, such as date palms. There are also those that have male and female elements in one flower, such as cotton trees.

5. Allah covers the day with the night, so that the bright atmosphere of nature changes into pitch darkness, as if covering something with a black cloth. Likewise, Allah illuminates the night with the day, so that the darkness disappears and nature appears bright and clear. All of this is made by Allah to perfect the benefits for humans by giving them the opportunity to rest and sleep at night and to work to earn a living during the day, in accordance with Allah's word:

"Have they not seen that We have made the night for them to rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe." (an-Naml/27: 86)

In verse 3 above, it is explained that Allah covers the day with the night. In other verses, it is also mentioned that the night covers the day and the day covers the night. The words used in Arabic are similar to a person wearing a turban, which is a cloth that covers another and covers the head in layers. Thus, the phrase "covering the day with the night" actually indicates that our planet Earth is round; not flat like the depiction of the ancient ignorant people (jahiliyyah).

After Allah explains the proofs of His power that can be seen by the eyes every morning and evening, every time and circumstance, then Allah explains that these signs are not heeded except by those who are grateful and contemplate His signs of power. Then, with their intellect, they can reach the truth and move from looking at the cause to the one who causes it. Indeed, in that are signs of Allah's greatness for a people who want to think that the creator of the universe is the Lord who has absolute will and power that encompasses everything, who is Able to bring to life what has died among His creatures, and to return them from the realm of annihilation. Therefore, worship should not be directed except to Him, and submission and surrender should not be directed except to His power. Worship should not be directed to statues, idols, stones, trees, angels, prophets, and so on, because these things cannot ward off harm from themselves, in accordance with Allah's word:

"Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from it. Weak are the pursuer and pursued." (al-Hajj/22: 73)

And it has also been narrated in a hadith of the Prophet saw:

"Reflect on the creation of Allah and do not reflect on Allah." (Narrated by Abu Nuaim from Ibn Abbas)
text.4:
This verse's expression is a continuation of the signs of Allah's power on earth, namely that on earth there are parts of land that are adjacent and side-by-side but differ in fertility. There is land that is very fertile for planting anything, and there is land that can only be planted with large trees, but is not good for planting secondary crops or vice versa, there is also soft land and there is also hard land that is difficult to cultivate. On earth there are vineyards, secondary crops, and trees that branch and do not branch. All of them are watered with the same water but produce fruits with a variety of tastes, such as sugarcane which tastes sweet, oranges which taste sweet and sour, and bitter melon which tastes bitter, and so on. Allah has favored some plants over others, both in terms of their shape, taste and smell. All these signs show Allah's power and are evidence that can create conviction for those who want to think.

According to scientists, the difference in taste of fruits or plants is due to differences in the chemical content within them. These chemical substances or molecules, in the language of biochemistry, are known as metabolites. It is the difference in the type and quantity of metabolites that gives different tastes to different plants or fruits. The seeds of all plants, almost all of them are the same shape or known to have the same morphology, or almost the same, namely a round or slightly oval morphology. All these seeds contain plant embryos (Encyclopedia Britannica, 1965, Vol.20, Seed, 273-275). The plant embryo contains genetic material (or what is often called DNA, Deoxyribonucleic Acid).

In different plant seeds, the embryonic content is different, as is the DNA content. DNA is a material that will greatly determine the process of metabolite formation in all living things, including plants. So, Glory be to Allah, when different seeds are planted and watered with the same water, the seeds will grow into various plants with different tastes, depending on the genetic material they contain; because this genetic material will determine (make) the metabolites in the plant that determine the taste of the fruit or plant.
text.5:
This verse explains the attitude of the disbelievers towards the Oneness of Allah, where Allah tells Prophet Muhammad that if he is amazed by their worship of idols that neither harm nor benefit after the proofs of Allah's Oneness have been presented, then what is more worthy of amazement is their statement denying the Day of Resurrection on the Day of Judgment. They say, "When we have become dust, shall we indeed be returned to a new creation?"

They utter these words of denial even though they do not deny Allah's power in creating them since they were in their mother's wombs. This question containing denial is repeatedly mentioned in eleven places in eight surahs in the Al-Quran, namely Surah ar-Rad/13: 5, al-Isra/17: 49 and 98, al-Muminun/23: 35 and 82, an-Nahl/16: 38, as-Sajdah/32: 10, ash-shaffat/37: 16 and 53, al-Waqiah/56: 47, and an-Naziat/79: 11. All of them contain very strong denial, giving the impression that the Day of Resurrection is impossible. According to them, it is impossible for a person who has died and become bones to live again. Then Allah affirms that those who deny the Day of Resurrection are also denying their Lord. Denying Allah's power is the same as denying Allah Himself. They will have shackles placed around their necks as a result of not believing in the truth and following guidance in the world. There are also those who interpret that on the Day of Judgment, when they are judged, several shackles will be placed around their necks like a prisoner. Allah says:

"When the shackles and chains are placed around their necks, they will be dragged into boiling water, then they will be burned in the Fire." (al-Mumin/40: 71-72)

They are the inhabitants of Hell, eternally therein, living in humiliation as a result of their disbelief and evil during their lives in the world.

Allah SWT, with His attribute of omnipotence, is able to create everything that exists in this world, both living and moving, and dead, even from non-existence to existence. Therefore, Allah will easily resurrect humans after death. Allah says:

"...he says, "Who will give life to bones when they are disintegrated?" Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time..." (Yasin/36: 78-79)

Allah says:

"Does man think that We will not assemble his bones? Yes, We are able to put his fingertips in perfect order." (al-Qiyamah/75: 3-4)
text.6:
After rejecting the Messenger and denying the torment of the Day of Judgment, they also denied the torment in the world that the Messenger of Allah had threatened them with. They asked him to hasten the coming of the punishment that had been threatened upon them. They should have asked for goodness and safety from the descent of torment and hoped for the reward promised by the Messenger of Allah in the Hereafter. In fact, various kinds of torment had been inflicted by Allah upon the nations that denied the previous messengers. Among them were those whose forms and characteristics were changed to be like monkeys, and some were destroyed by earthquakes, and so on. Their situation of preferring to challenge the descent of torment rather than asking for goodness is also mentioned in Allah's word:

And (remember) when they (the polytheists) said, "O Allah, if this (the Quran) is indeed the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment." (al-Anfal/8: 32)

Indeed, Allah truly has vast forgiveness for the sins of His servants who repent and covers their mistakes on the Day of Judgment. If He were not Most Forbearing, Allah would surely punish mankind for their wrongdoing. Allah's word:

And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon [the earth] any creature. (Fathir/35: 45)

Indeed, Allah's punishment is very severe for those who commit evil and continue to wallow in error and sin. Some punishments are hastened to descend in the world as a result of various sins, such as the impaired health of people who habitually drink alcohol, the bankruptcy of people who like to gamble even though they were previously rich, and a corrupt person who is removed from his high position because of involvement in corruption and manipulation. Often, forgiveness from Allah is mentioned alongside punishment so that a servant of Allah is always in the middle position between *khauf* and *raja'* (fear of Allah's punishment and hope of obtaining His forgiveness), as in Allah's word:

Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful. (al-Araf/7: 167)
text.7:
In this verse, it is explained how the disbelievers spoke to the Prophet Muhammad with a challenging tone, asking why a sign of greatness from his Lord was not revealed to him, such as the staff as a miracle given to Prophet Musa and the camel to Prophet Saleh, and why Muhammad could not turn the Safa hill into gold or transform these hills into valleys with flowing rivers. They demanded this because they thought that the Quran was not a miracle. Allah SWT has rejected their demands with His word:

And nothing prevents Us from sending the signs except that the former peoples denied them. (al-Isra/17: 59)

The established Sunnatullah is that if signs of Allah's power have been requested, and after those signs are revealed, but those who demand them still rebel and do not believe, they will surely be destroyed by Allah's punishment. Allah does not want that to happen, so He does not send down miraculous signs as they demand. Prophet Muhammad SAW has been given other miracles to show the truth of his message. The main task of Prophet Muhammad SAW is only to convey his message, like the tasks of the prophets before him, not to fulfill the proposals and requests of his people so that they can receive guidance. The matter of giving guidance into someone's heart is only in Allah's hands and is not the authority of Prophet Muhammad, as explained in Allah's word:

Not upon you, [O Muhammad], is [responsibility for] their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. (al-Baqarah/2: 272)

Indeed, Prophet Muhammad is only a warner. For every nation, there is a leader who gives guidance to goodness. They are the prophets, and if they are gone, then the wise, scholars, and *mujtahidin* who continue the task of the prophets to explore and explain the *sharia* in more detail, which contains elements of good morals and guidelines for human life. Allah's word:

And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner. (Fathir/35: 24)
text.8:
This verse explains that Allah knows what every woman carries in her womb, whether the contents are male or female, single or twins, and whether their lifespan will be long or short, as mentioned in His word:

"He knows best about you, ever since He created you from the earth and ever since you were embryos in the wombs of your mothers." (an-Najm/53: 32)

Allah knows the imperfect contents of the womb, where the baby has physical defects. Allah knows the contents of the womb that are twins, triplets, quadruplets, or more, and those whose gestation period is a perfect nine months, less than that, or more. According to research by several hospitals in London, a fetus cannot live in its mother's womb for more than 305 days, while according to research by hospitals in Berlin, it is no more than 308 days. For everything, there is a measure with Allah SWT, with no deficiency or addition, as mentioned in His word:

"Indeed, We have created all things with precise measure." (al-Qamar/54: 49)

The verse above provides a statement regarding the embryological processes that occur in the womb. The complete verses regarding the changes that occur in the human embryological process can be seen in Surah Al-Muminun/23: 12-16, a fragment of which is as follows: "And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay. Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging."

Two other verses that generally discuss the stages of human development. The first is Surah Nuh/71: 13-14 as follows: "What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allah [due] grandeur While He has created you in stages?" The second is Surah Fathir/35: 11, a fragment of which is as follows: "And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates (male and female)."
text.9: This verse explains that He is the Lord Who knows the unseen, the visible, and that which cannot be known by human senses. Science has proven that there are creatures that cannot be seen with the naked eye because they are so small. They can only be seen with microscopes and telescopes, such as bacteria and viruses that can transmit various diseases that are very difficult to eradicate, or for which a cure has not yet been found. These bacteria and viruses are among Allah's soldiers, whose number cannot be known except by Allah Himself, as explained in His word:
text.10:
Furthermore, this verse explains Allah's attribute of being All-Knowing regarding a person who keeps his words secret and stores them in his heart, or who speaks them openly. All of that is the same before Allah. Nothing is hidden or concealed from Him. As Allah says:

"And if you speak aloud, then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden." (Taha/20:7)

Likewise, Allah knows who hides at night and walks openly in the daytime. All of that remains within the scope of His knowledge because Allah is All-Knowing of everything. Allah says:

"And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record." (al-An'am/6:59)
text.11:
This verse explains that Allah swt assigns several angels to always follow humans in shifts, in front and behind them. They guard them by the command of Allah. There are angels assigned to guard humans at night, and some during the day, protecting them from various dangers and harms. There are also angels who record all the deeds of humans, good or bad, namely the angels on the right and left. The angel on the right records all good deeds, and the one on the left records evil deeds, and two other angels, one in front and one behind. Every person has four angels during the day and four at night. They come in shifts, as explained in a sahih hadith:

"There are angels who guard you in shifts at night and during the day. They meet (to hand over duties) at the time of the Fajr prayer and the Asr prayer, then the angels who guarded at night ascend to Allah Taala. He asks, while He already knows what He will ask, "How were My servants when you left them (in the world)?" The angels reply, "We came to them while they were praying and we left them, and they were also praying." (Narrated by al-Bukhari from Abu Hurairah)

If humans know that there are angels beside them recording all their deeds and watching them, then they must always guard themselves from acts of disobedience because every activity will be seen by those angels. The supervision of angels over human actions can be believed to be true after science created modern tools that can record all events that occur to humans. For example, measuring devices for electricity and drinking water usage in every city and village have been arranged in such a way that it can be known how much has been used and how much must be paid by the user. Likewise, tools installed in motor vehicles can record their speed and measure how far they have traveled.

The development of science that can reveal various unseen matters is proof that can give us confidence in the truth of religious provisions. It also becomes a reason to convince people who are controlled by the doctrine of materialism, so that they acknowledge the existence of unseen things that cannot be felt and known only with the five senses. Therefore, it is very appropriate for people to say that the position of religion and knowledge in Islam is like two inseparable twins, or like two friends who are always together in harmony and do not contradict each other.

Those angels guard humans by the command of Allah and with His permission. They carry out their duties perfectly. Just as in the material world there is a close relationship between cause and effect, in accordance with His wisdom, such as the existence of eyelids that can protect the eyes from objects that might enter and damage them, so too in spirituality, Allah has assigned several angels to guard humans from various harms and temptations of lust and Satan.

Allah swt has assigned the angels to record the deeds of humans even though we do not know how they record them. We know that Allah Himself is sufficient to know it, but why does He still assign angels to record it? Perhaps there is wisdom in it so that humans are more submissive and careful in acting because Allah's omniscience encompasses them. Their deeds are recorded accurately so that later no one will feel wronged in Allah's judgment.

Ali bin Abi Talib said that there is no servant except that there is an angel who guards him from falling walls, falling into wells, being eaten by wild animals, drowning, or burning. However, when certainty comes from Allah or when death comes, they allow humans to be struck by disasters and so on.

Allah will not change the condition of a nation from the blessings and prosperity it enjoys to destruction and misery, unless they themselves change it. This is caused by acts of oppression and mutual hostility, as well as committing damage and sin on earth. Hadith of Rasulullah saw:

"If people see someone who is unjust and do not act against him, then it is very possible that Allah will send down a punishment that affects them all." (Narrated by Abu Dawud, at-Tirmidzi, and Ibnu Majah from Abu Bakar ash-shiddiq)

This statement is reinforced by Allah's word:

"And guard yourselves against a punishment which does not fall exclusively on those of you who do wrong." (al-Anfal/8: 25)

The Muslims in the first phase of the spread of Islam followed the teachings of the Al-Quran with full conviction and awareness, so that they became the best people among humans. They controlled various prosperous regions at that time, and defeated the Roman and Persian empires by implementing wisdom in just governance, and witnessed by their enemies. The oppressed were defended in order to uphold justice. Therefore, the Islamic religion has been recognized as an absolute element in building the character of the nation and developing the country.

After their generation passed and was replaced by later generations, it turned out that many neglected the religious teachings about justice and truth, so that their condition changed into a despicable nation. Whereas before that, they were a respected, authoritative, noble, and respected nation by friends and foes alike. They became a nation enslaved by colonialists, whereas previously they were rulers. They became a nation that followed, whereas in the past they were a leading nation.

Ibn Khaldun in his Muqaddimah has included a chapter entitled: Oppression can Destroy Prosperity. He presented several examples in history before and after Islam, that oppression destroys the power of Muslims and degrades their status, so that it becomes an erosion from all nations. The once glorious Muslim community has been mired for several centuries under the power and colonialism of Westerners.

If Allah intends evil for a people with disease, poverty, or various other trials as a result of the bad deeds they do, then no one can reject it and there is no protector for them other than Allah.
text.12:
He is the Lord who shows you lightning, inspiring fear of being struck by lightning for those who are in the open or traveling. But sometimes lightning and thunder bring hope to others, such as farmers who hope for rain to irrigate their fields. Likewise, everything in the world is sometimes seen as good because it is needed at certain times, and sometimes seen as bad considering the harm it may cause. Allah is also the One who creates thunderclouds containing rainwater, and because of their weight, these clouds pour down onto the earth's surface as rain.

According to scientists, the formation of thunderclouds, lightning, thunder, and lightning strikes, as revealed in the Quran, has long been believed by many scientists to be a natural phenomenon closely related to the process of rain and/or storms that often occur on the earth's surface. This phenomenon is one of the signs of Allah's power and might.

Indeed, not all types of clouds can bring rain. The clouds that can cause rain are cumulonimbus clouds. According to scientists, the clouds that form will produce a separation of positive and negative (electrical) charges. Positive charges generally accumulate in the upper part of the cloud, while negative charges accumulate in the lower part of the cloud. These charges will flow in various ways, such as between charge pockets in the cloud, from the cloud to the earth, released through the air as electrostatic charge flow, and jump to the ionosphere. This giant spark jump is known as lightning, flash, or lightning strike. As a result, the air splits, and the strike, which has a speed of up to 150,000 km/second, will produce a rumbling sound that we usually call thunder, rumble, or thunder. The sound of thunder shrinks the hearts of people who hear it, and its impact can often be fatal to humans. This is what is meant by "frightening lightning."

Benjamin Franklin (1752) successfully proved that lightning is a very large electrical discharge. From the research, it was later discovered that the minimum electric field that allows lightning to be triggered is about 1,000,000 volts per meter.

Under certain conditions, the earth, which tends to be a static electricity damper, can also interact. This is made possible by the concentration of positively charged electricity due to the charge difference between the base of the cloud and the earth's surface. What happens next is the transfer of electrical charge. So physically we will see lightning strikes with such a large electrical charge, which will then immediately spread to the surface of the earth, then spread into the ground and finally be neutralized at a depth containing groundwater. The place where this electrical charge transfer occurs often brings disaster and damage. This is what is commonly known as being struck by lightning or thunder.

From another observation, it is known that lightning has benefits for the earth and humans. Lightning is a natural process that produces the element nitrogen, which is needed by plants and fills about 4/5 of the earth's atmosphere. Lightning also functions in the global electrical circuit. Giant lightning flashes are believed to help balance the global electrical circuit between earth and space and also concentrate in the formation of ozone. In addition, the sparkling lightning can produce mushrooms. According to research in Japan, shiitake mushrooms can grow well if the seeds that are sown are given an electric shock, which is the same as the effect of lightning. This is based on the experience that after there was lightning the previous afternoon, many mushrooms grew around it the next day. In addition, the length (strength) of lightning can predict the amount of rainfall that will fall the next day. This is the explanation from the scientist's point of view.
text.13:
The thunderous sound produced by lightning due to massive electrical discharge, according to the Quran, is its glorification (tasbih) in praising Allah. This is a sign of its submission to Allah, sanctifying Him from association and expressing its weakness compared to the power of its Creator, the Most High and Most Great. Every object that makes a sound, that sound signifies tasbih, only humans do not understand its language:

"And there is not a thing but glorifies Him [Allah] with praise, but you do not understand their glorification." (al-Isra/17: 44)

When we hear the sound of thunder and lightning, it is recommended to recite a prayer, as in the hadith of the Messenger of Allah narrated by al-Bukhari, Ahmad, at-Tirmidhi, an-Nasai from Ibn Umar, that the Prophet Muhammad saw when he heard the sound of thunder and lightning, he would recite:

"Ya Allah, do not kill us with Your wrath, do not destroy us with Your punishment, and grant us health before that."

Ibn Mardawaih narrated a hadith from Abu Hurairah as follows:

That the Messenger of Allah saw, when there was a strong wind blowing, or he heard the sound of thunder, the color of his face would change, then he would say to the thunder, "Glory be to the One to Whom the thunder glorifies." And to the wind he would say, "Ya Allah, make this wind a mercy and do not make it a punishment."

Likewise, the angels glorify Allah out of fear of Him and praise Him. Allah unleashes lightning, striking whom He wills and destroying them. Nevertheless, they still dispute about the attributes of Allah that have been explained by His Messenger, such as: His perfect knowledge, power, oneness, and His decree to resurrect mankind on the Day of Judgment to hold them accountable on the Day of Judgment and recompense.

In this verse, Allah swt commands the Prophet to be patient with the denial of the polytheists who demand that he bring miracles like the staff of Moses, the miracles of Jesus, and others. In fact, the Quran itself is the greatest and eternal miracle, which cannot be imitated by anyone. Allah commands the Prophet to be patient because they have gone too far as to deny the divinity of Allah and His Oneness, associating various partners with Him, saying that Allah has a son, and denying the existence of the Day of Resurrection and Recompense. In this way, Allah swt comforts the Prophet's heart so that he does not get lost in sadness in facing all these challenges, and declares that He is the Lord Who is Severe (in His punishment), as stated in His word:

"And such is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe." (Hud/11: 102)
text.14: This verse explains that only Allah has the authority to grant true prayers. There are also those who interpret it as: only to Allah is the true call regarding monotheism, purity, and sincerity in worship. The idols worshiped by the polytheists cannot grant their requests in the slightest. Asking something of idols is like a person wanting to drink, but only by opening both palms into the water. He hopes that the water will rise into his mouth on its own. However, the water will certainly not be able to enter his mouth by itself without first being scooped up with both palms. Similarly, the idols they worship, let alone fulfill the requests of their worshipers, they cannot even answer if asked. The prayers and worship of the disbelievers to idols are only in vain. If they pray to Allah, their prayers are not answered because they do not believe in His power. If they pray to idols, they cannot even hear, let alone grant their requests.
text.15:
This verse affirms that only to Allah do all angels, jinn, and believing humans submit, prostrate, and obey, both in times of ease and hardship, those in the heavens and on earth, willingly and sincerely of their own volition. As for the disbelievers, they only submit and obey when in a state of emergency or distress, as in Allah's saying:

And when harm touches you upon the sea, those that you call upon vanish from you except Him. (al-Isra/17: 67)

Then when they embark on a ship, they invoke Allah, sincere to Him in religion, but when He delivers them to the land, at once they associate others with Him. (al-Ankabut/29: 65)

Allah explains that it is not only their bodies that submit, prostrate, and obey Allah, but also their shadows prostrate in the morning and evening. Every object that is exposed to sunlight, especially in the morning and evening, will certainly have its shadow appear shorter or longer. All objects and their shadows submit to Allah, whether willingly or unwillingly. This demonstrates Allah's perfect power.
text.16:
This verse explains that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked by Allah (SWT) to ask those who associate partners with Allah, "Who is the creator of the universe whose beauty greatly amazes mankind?" Then the Prophet himself was asked to answer that question and say to them, "It is Allah who created everything, regulates it, and maintains it in an orderly and perfect manner." Allah (SWT) commanded the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to answer that question because the answer would be the same as what the polytheists themselves would say. They would not deny that the creator is Allah Himself, as mentioned in His word:

And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?" they will surely say, "Allah." Then how are they turned away? (al-Ankabut/29: 61)

If Allah is indeed the creator of the universe, is it fitting for them to take protectors besides Allah, even though the idols they worship cannot provide benefit or ward off harm? Why do they still make these inanimate objects their protectors? Why don't they use their minds to make the right choice? Even though these objects have no ability whatsoever, not even to create a fly. Allah's word:

Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away a bit from them, they could not recover it from him. (al-hajj/22: 73)

Then, in order to unveil the narrowness of their minds, so that they cannot compare between good and bad, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was commanded to say to them, is the blind person, who cannot see at all, the same as the person whose eyes are healthy, who can see all objects in front of him clearly and brightly? Of course, the answer is no. If they are also asked, is darkness the same as bright light? Of course, the answer is also no. Thus, it can finally be concluded that Allah, the One and Perfect in everything, cannot be equated with idols, inanimate objects that cannot provide benefit or ward off harm. Likewise, a person's disbelief in Allah and His Messenger is not the same as the light of faith of a believer that radiates from his face and heart. The next question is, can the idols they worship create creatures like Allah's creation, so that the two creations are similar in their view, and it is difficult to distinguish which is the creation of the idol and which is the creation of Allah?

If Allah could be equated with idols in creation, then there would be a reason for them to associate partners with Him. However, the reality is not so. The idols are inanimate objects; let alone their creation being equated with Allah's creation, their existence is only because they are carved by human hands. They cannot answer if asked and cannot provide benefit or harm in the slightest to their worshippers. If the offerings placed in front of them are stolen by a fly, they cannot retrieve them at all. Even if their worshippers are negligent, a wolf can urinate on their heads.

Allah is the Creator of everything, including the Creator of idols, and He is Allah, the One, the Almighty. Why do you worship others besides Him, who do not provide any benefit or harm?
text.17:
Allah sends down rainwater from the sky containing clouds, then directs that rainwater to various valleys, wide and narrow, according to their size. Scientific studies explain that valleys are generally formed by water erosion. Water first erodes the softest parts of the rocks and then forms river flows. The course of this river flow gradually expands, forming river valleys. The size of river valleys is generally influenced not only by the size of the water flow, which is also determined by the amount of rainfall, the hardness of the rocks, and the age of the rocks. In the field of geomorphology, the magnitude of river density is known, which is the total length of rivers found in an area with units of km/km2. The magnitude of river density generally describes the amount of rainfall in the area.

The water flow will create a lot of foam on its surface, which is a clump of foam that moves with the water flow, so that if there is a strong wind blowing, the foam will immediately disappear from sight. According to scientific studies, foam is a substance floating on water that contains a lot of air. The formation of foam is part of the water purification process that occurs naturally in its flow (known as self-purification). This purification occurs due to mixing with air that dissolves into the water, especially oxygen. With oxidation, impurities (generally organic compounds) dissolved in the water decompose, and the light parts float on the surface of the water, while the heavy parts will sink and settle. This is the first parable presented by Allah swt about truth and falsehood, and about faith and disbelief.

Foam can also be formed in the process of purifying metals by heating. Metal ores in nature are generally found in impure solid materials. In the smelting process, the ore melts, and heavy metals will sink, while the less useful parts or those that can damage the quality of the product are usually in the form of foam and will float to the surface along with the air contained in it. The metal is made for jewelry and household, agricultural, carpentry, and industrial tools. This is the second parable.

Thus Allah makes parables for what is true and what is false. Truth and falsehood, when mixed, are like water currents mixed with foam, or like metal being burned, which also produces foam in the form of rust dirt that was originally attached to the metal, then separated due to the influence of the fire that burns it. So, just as the foam on the water current will disappear after a gust of wind, and the foam on the metal being burned will also disappear because of the fire, so too will the matter of falsehood disappear when clear truth and righteousness come.

The foam will disappear, getting caught on the edge of the valley and trees, or blown away by the wind. Likewise, the dirt or rust that was originally attached to the metal will be completely burned. What remains is only what benefits humans, namely water, which can be drunk, used to irrigate plants that are beneficial to humans and animals, gold that is used for jewelry, and other metals for household tools, agriculture, and so on.

From these two parables, it can be understood that Allah swt has revealed the Al-Quran to the Prophet Muhammad saw and then conveyed it into the hearts of humans, each of whom has different potentials and preparations for receiving it. Each has limitations in terms of reading, understanding, memorizing, and practicing it. The verses of the Al-Quran become elements of spiritual life and happiness, just as water is the cause of life for all creatures.

Among the land that is hit by rain, some are barren, unable to grow plants, only storing water, which can be used as a source of clear water storage. There is also fertile land which, after being watered with rainwater, can produce various kinds of produce. That is water that is beneficial to humans and animals. Among the metals that are melted in fire, such as gold, silver, copper, bronze, and tin, some are made into household, carpentry, industrial tools, and so on. A believer is likened to water and metal that are beneficial to humans and animals. The foam that was originally mixed and then disappears due to the wind or is burned by fire, is a parable for disbelief and falsehood that eventually collapses when faced with truth and righteousness, the word of Allah:

And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished." Indeed, falsehood is ever vanishing. (al-Isra/17: 81)

Thus Allah makes beautiful parables that can explain to humans what they still consider difficult about matters of their religion, so that the difference between what is right and what is wrong, between faith and disbelief, is clear, so that they can take the path of guidance to happiness and avoid the path that is displeasing to Allah and misleading.

By paying attention to these precise and good parables, the Muslim community will surely become the best community brought forth on earth to be an example for other communities. Al-Bukhari and Muslim narrated a hadith from Abu Musa Al-Asyari:

Indeed, the parable of guidance and knowledge with which Allah sent me is like rainwater that falls on the earth. Among them, there is some earth that receives the water, then grows grass and plants. There is also barren land, only storing water, then Allah gives the benefit of that water to humans. So there are those who drink it and use it to irrigate their gardens, plants, and fields. There is also some hard land that cannot store and absorb water, so it does not grow any plants. That is the parable of the person who understands the religion of Allah and Allah gives him benefit in the teachings of religion that Allah sent me to convey to humans, so he knows and teaches it (to others), and the parable of the person who does not pay attention at all and does not accept the guidance of Allah who sent me to convey it. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

It was also narrated by Imam Ahmad from Abu Hurairah:

My parable with you is like a person lighting a fire, when the fire illuminates the surrounding area, butterflies and insects begin to come and fall into the fire, and that person prevents them, but is defeated by the insects, then the insects enter the fire. That is my parable with you. I prevent you from the fire, stay away from the fire, but you defeat me and break into it. (Narrated by Ahmad, al-Bukhari, and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)
text.18:
For those who are obedient to Allah and His Messenger, following all His commands, and affirming what Allah has revealed to His Messenger, a good reward is prepared, which is free from all suffering and hardship and everlasting. This is in accordance with Allah's word:

For those who do good is the best (reward) and extra. (Yunus/10: 26)

And His word:

As for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have the best reward, and we will speak to him from our command with ease. (al-Kahf/18: 88)

For those who do not answer Allah's call, do not obey Him, do not follow His commands, and do not refrain from His prohibitions, there are various treatments and punishments, including:

1. When facing a very painful torment, they will surely release all their wealth to ransom themselves from Allah's torment. Because what is most loved by everyone is themselves. If they are threatened with danger, all their wealth will be used as collateral or ransom, for the sake of their own safety.

2. They will be examined in detail and all their deeds will be scrutinized, even the smallest ones. It is mentioned in a hadith: Whoever is reckoned in detail will surely be punished.

3. Their abode is Hell, and that is the worst abode and destination.
text.19:
In this verse, Allah swt explains that those who know that what was revealed to Muhammad is the truth and comes from Allah are not the same as the blind who do not understand and believe it. Allah says:

"And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice." (al-Anam/6: 115)

According to Ibn Abbas, this verse was revealed in connection with two people, one a believer and the other a disbeliever, namely Hamzah and Abu Jahal. Is (Hamzah), who believes and knows that what was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad saw is true, without any doubt, the same as (Abu Jahal) who is blind in his heart and receives no guidance to goodness? Certainly not the same. Only those who are sound in mind can realize such a thing, and who can benefit from the parables presented by Allah swt in His Holy Book.
text.20:
Allah swt describes *ulul albab* from among the believers, those who believe that what was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad is a prevailing truth, as follows:

a. The first characteristic: that these people always fulfill Allah's promise and do not want to break that covenant. What is meant by "Allah's promise" here is the promises they have made to themselves, both regarding their relationship with Allah and their relationship with others. Their pure *fitrah*, and their pure hearts acknowledge the existence of this covenant, and Allah's revelation also requires the existence of this covenant.

They do not want to deny or break the covenant they have established, because they strongly avoid the characteristics of hypocrisy.

How important this characteristic of fulfilling promises is, Qatadah has mentioned that in the Al-Quran, Allah swt has mentioned it more than twenty times.

b. The second characteristic: they maintain all of Allah's commands and do not violate them, both the rights of Allah and the rights of His servants, including maintaining *silaturrahim* (kinship ties).

The relationship between humans is to establish mutual help, love, and affection, as mentioned in the hadith:

From Abi Hurairah r.a. that he said, "I heard Rasulullah saw say, "Whoever is pleased to have his sustenance expanded and his good deeds always mentioned, then let him maintain *silaturrahim*." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim).

And the hadith of the Prophet saw:

From Ibn Abbas he said, "Rasulullah saw said, "Indeed, goodness and maintaining *silaturrahim* both truly lighten the bad reckoning on the Day of Judgment." Then Rasulullah saw recited this verse." (Narrated by al-Khatib and Ibn Asakir)

c. The third characteristic: they truly fear Allah swt. The characteristic of fearing Allah is a feeling of fear based on respect that encourages a person to obey Him. This characteristic is possessed by the *ulama*, and is a characteristic of the "muqarrabin" (those brought near to Allah). In this regard, Allah swt has said:

"Among His servants, only those who have knowledge fear Allah." (Fathir/35: 28)

d. The fourth characteristic: they are always afraid of a reckoning that is detrimental to them on the Day of Judgment, namely the bad results of their deeds on the Day of Judgment, because of the many evils they committed while living in this world. Therefore, they are always self-aware, before their deeds are reckoned in the hereafter. They always compare their good deeds with their bad deeds, always striving to ensure that good deeds outweigh bad deeds, so that their scales of good deeds in the hereafter are heavier than their scales of bad deeds. In this case, Allah has said:

"Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds], He will be in a pleasant life. But as for one whose scales are light, His refuge will be an abyss." (al-Qariah/101: 6 - 9)

e. The fifth characteristic: they are always patient in facing all trials and obstacles, in order to seek Allah's pleasure. Patience in this case means restraining oneself from all things that are disliked, both by performing obedience and fulfilling all the obligations that have been stipulated by religion and by avoiding things that are forbidden by religion. It can also mean being willing to accept all of Allah's decrees that have taken effect in the form of calamities and so on.

The patience that is requested from every intelligent and believing person is patience that is done solely for the sake of seeking Allah's pleasure and reward, not patience that is fabricated because they want to be praised and mentioned. That is true patience, which is a characteristic of intelligent and believing people.

f. The sixth characteristic: they always establish prayer. The meaning of "establishing prayer" is to perform it in the best possible way, by perfecting its pillars and conditions, accompanied by *khusyuk* (humility) and *tawaduk* (submission), directing the face and heart to Allah alone, not accompanied by *ria* (showing off), and maintaining the time that has been set for it. This can only be done if, at the time of performing prayer, we feel that we are standing alone before Allah swt, the Creator and Ruler of the universe. Thus, there is nothing to think about at that time, except solely supplicating to Allah.

g. The seventh characteristic: they always spend a portion of the sustenance that Allah has bestowed upon them, both secretly and openly, both obligatory spending such as on wives, children, and close relatives, and voluntary spending such as on the poor and needy. Reality can give us an understanding of the secrets that are stored within it. The Al-Quran repeatedly encourages believers to spend a portion of the sustenance they have obtained on those who need help, and to support the public interest. If they are willing to do so, poverty and misery can be eliminated from the life of society.

h. The eighth characteristic: they always repel evil with good, because goodness can repel evil. Reality shows that if a person can associate with others with intimacy and affection and help those who need help, he will not be opposed or hated by his community. If he suffers a disaster, then those who have received his help will immediately extend help to him. Conversely, people who like to hurt others, or are reluctant to provide assistance and help, are selfish people and do not use their minds. Their attitudes and actions only narrow the scope of their own lives, and cause hatred and envy from others towards them.

Doing good to avoid evil, or as much as possible repaying the evil deeds of others by doing good or by remaining silent, is a sign of a person who wants to use his mind and is wise. Allah's word:

"... and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace." (al-Furqan/25: 63)

From this it can be understood how high the value of Islamic teachings is in fostering good relations between humans in order to create harmony and prosperity in society.

At the end of this verse, Allah swt affirms that people who have these characteristics will surely obtain a good final abode, namely the *Jannatun Naim* (Gardens of Bliss) in the hereafter, in addition to happiness, tranquility, and prosperity in this world.

"It is only those who have knowledge among His servants that fear Allah." (Fathir/35: 28)

d. This can only be done if, at the time of performing prayer, we feel that we are standing alone before Allah SWT, the Creator and Ruler of the universe. Thus, there is nothing else to think about at that time, except solely supplicating to Allah.

g. Reality can give us an understanding of the secrets contained within it. The Al-Quran repeatedly encourages believers to spend a portion of the sustenance they have obtained on those who need help, and to support the public interest. If they are willing to do so, poverty and misery can certainly be eliminated from the life of society.

h. The eighth characteristic: they always repel evil with good, because good can repel evil. Reality shows that if a person can associate with others with intimacy and affection and help those who need help, he will not be opposed or hated by his community. If he suffers a disaster, then the person who has received his help will immediately extend help to him. Conversely, a person who likes to hurt others, or is reluctant to provide assistance and help, is an egoistic person and does not use his mind. His attitude and actions only narrow the scope of his own life, and cause hatred and envy from others towards him.

Doing good to avoid evil, or as much as possible repaying the evil deeds of others by doing good or by remaining silent, is a sign of a person who is willing to use his mind and is wise. Allah's word:

"... and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace." (al-Furqan/25: 63)

From this, it can be understood how high the value of Islamic teachings is in fostering good relations between fellow human beings in order to create harmony and prosperity in society.

At the end of this verse, Allah SWT affirms that people who have these characteristics will certainly obtain a good final abode, namely the Paradise of Jannatun Naim in the hereafter, in addition to happiness, tranquility, and prosperity in this world.
text.22:
